name: St. Martha

locations.description: Sister of Lazarus and Mary, friend of Jesus in Bethany

summary: Martha of Bethany was the sister of Lazarus and Mary, and a close friend of Jesus. She is known for her practical service and hospitality, welcoming Jesus into her home. In the Gospel of Luke, she is shown serving while her sister Mary sits at Jesus' feet, leading to Jesus' teaching that 'Mary has chosen the better part.' She is also the one who professed faith in Jesus before he raised Lazarus from the dead, declaring, 'I believe that you are the Christ, the Son of God.' She is the patron saint of cooks, servants, and hospitality.
keyQuotes: Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died. But even now I know that whatever you ask from God, God will give you.
Yes, Lord; I believe that you are the Christ, the Son of God.
